metadata.title: CVE-2023-1382 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A data race flaw was found in the Linux kernel, between where con isallocated and con->sock is set. This issue leads to a NULL pointerdereference when accessing con->sock->sk in net/tipc/topsrv.c in the tipcprotocol in the Linux kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-67.74~20.04.1
